description: A gamified, 5-level preparedness curriculum. Each level consists of 4 checklists: two 'Quick Wins' (4 options) and two 'Deep Dives' (6 options) to gradually increase user engagement.

quizzes.title: Digital Vault
quizzes.prompt: Have you saved digital copies of these critical documents on your phone or cloud?

quizzes.title: Personal Carry
quizzes.prompt: Do you have these essentials in your everyday bag or pockets?

quizzes.title: The Lifeline Check
quizzes.prompt: Let’s verify your communication readiness. Have you...
options: Signed up for local SMS emergency alerts
Taught family members how to text vs. call
Programmed 'ICE' (In Case of Emergency) in phone
Downloaded offline maps for your area
Agreed on a physical family meeting spot

quizzes.title: Family Protocol
quizzes.prompt: Ensure everyone is on the same page. Have you discussed:
options: Where to meet if separated near home
Where to meet if separated outside the neighborhood
Who picks up the children from school
How to use the 'I am Safe' feature on social media
A secret password for children to trust strangers
Location of the nearest police station

quizzes.title: The Core Four
quizzes.prompt: Check off the absolute survival essentials in your bag:
options: Water (1 liter per person or purification tablets)

quizzes.title: Hygiene & Health
quizzes.prompt: Sanitation prevents illness during crisis. Do you have:

quizzes.title: The Hardware Haul
quizzes.prompt: Let’s finish the kit with tools and shelter items:

quizzes.title: Advanced First Aid
quizzes.prompt: Upgrade your basic kit. Do you have these trauma supplies?

quizzes.title: Utility Mastery
quizzes.prompt: Do you know exactly where these are located and how to shut them off?
options: Gas Valve (and have a wrench nearby)

quizzes.title: Fire & Safety
quizzes.prompt: Check your home safety hardware:

quizzes.title: Flood & Storm Defense
quizzes.prompt: If a storm warning triggers, are you ready to secure the house?
options: Important documents stored in waterproof container
Electronics elevated off the ground floor
Gutters and drains cleared of debris

quizzes.title: Evacuation Security
quizzes.prompt: If you must leave immediately, is your home ready to be left?
options: Valuables moved to upper floor or attic
Mail delivery paused or neighbor notified

quizzes.title: The Vulnerable Check
quizzes.prompt: Have you accounted for specific needs in your household?
options: Baby supplies (Formula, diapers) OR Mobility aids

quizzes.title: Pet Protocol
quizzes.prompt: Don't leave them behind. Do you have:
options: Photo of you with your pet (proof of ownership)

quizzes.title: The Network
quizzes.prompt: Building resilience beyond your front door:
options: Shared spare key with a trusted neighbor
Identified neighbors who might need help
Know the route to the nearest designated shelter
Know the route to the nearest hospital
Have a physical map of the local area
Joined a local neighborhood watch/chat group

quizzes.title: External Support
quizzes.prompt: Do you know where to find help if local services fail?
options: Frequency of local emergency radio station
Contact for local Red Cross / NGO chapter
Location of high ground / flood evacuation point

quizzes.title: Skill Check
quizzes.prompt: Items break; skills remain. Can you:
options: Change a tire on your vehicle

quizzes.title: Vehicle Readiness
quizzes.prompt: If you need to evacuate by car:
options: Gas tank always kept at least half full

quizzes.title: The Annual Audit
quizzes.prompt: The final step is maintenance. Have you recently:
options: Checked food expiry dates and replaced items
Updated children's photos in digital vault
Reviewed insurance coverage for current value
Conducted a 5-minute drill with the household

quizzes.title: Long-Term Resilience
quizzes.prompt: Preparing for extended disruptions (1+ weeks):
options: Camping stove or alternative cooking method
Extra supply of critical prescription meds
Warm clothing / sleeping bags for all
